result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquico Trailshaun Wilder

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquico Trailshaun Wilder not in court.  Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo in court for Marquico Trailshaun Wilder.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for a Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 29th, 2022.

Defendant Marquico Trailshaun Wilder in court.  Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo in court for Marquico Trailshaun Wilder.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a calendar call. DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court canceled stayed bench warrant. Defense counsel in receipt of discovery and offer. Case in DPA posture, defendant needs to complete TAD evaluation.
Case adjourned.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
Case in court for pretrial conference.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.
Court ordered case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Calendar call scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 6/15/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.A.W

Defendant Marquico Trailshaun Wilder in court.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/13/2022 @ 2:30p
